text: I joined Bloomberg Radio to discuss ensuring this $2 trillion of taxpayer money from the CARES Act is used efficiently and effectively in combatting Coronavirus. You work hard for the money you send to Washington ‚Äì it always needs to be working for you: https://t.co/xQg4R5eFhK

Listen In: I joined @ChamberBloom to discuss the #CARESAct, what it means for small businesses, and where they can turn to best help their employees + the future of their business. New resources are coming in by the truck load, so Erin and I break everything down for you here ‚Üí https://t.co/Y30x2Ong5y

If you visit my website at https://t.co/xwTyB8f3BM you can find information on everything from how to apply for unemployment insurance to resources for veteran healthcare during coronavirus. My team is updating this site daily with new information and the latest guidance.

Hoosiers, as we work together to fight coronavirus, there are numerous resources available from the Indiana state government, the federal government, and the private sector to help lessen the burden on Hoosiers and help families through this tough time.

According to the @Indiana_EDC, Employees for essential businesses do NOT need documentation. Law enforcement will not be stopping drivers on their way to work, traveling for an essential activity, or simply taking a walk. For more clarification: https://t.co/umRPGQCNHV

Today @GovHolcomb announced a statewide order for Hoosiers to stay home in an effort to stop the spread of coronavirus. Head to my website for FAQs on what this stay at home order means for you and your family ‚Üí https://t.co/umRPGQCNHV https://t.co/3BpmRHE0uf

We have a duty in Congress to keep Americans safe, help our economy heal, & help Hoosiers stay on their feet. I voted tonight for the Families First Coronavirus Response Act to provide necessary and affirmative relief to all sectors of our economy and employees affected. (2/2)

The deep economic uncertainty caused by social distancing ‚Äì a necessary effort encouraged by medical professionals to prevent the further spread of coronavirus - is hurting all sectors of our economy including our small businesses. (1/2)
